intro: Leptaxis menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' leptaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streamside areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive silvery-white underside, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. Leptaxis menziesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
